page.title: 02Our School
page.content: There is only one school in this district.It is called Indian Queens County Primary School and it is on the Suncrest Estate.It was built and opened in 1980 to take the place of the school that was built out along the A30 in 1878.In the Summer Term 1985 there were 156 full time pupils from 5 to 11,and 52 in the Nursery Unit.The Nursery Unit has children part time from 3years old to 5 years old.Our school is much better than the old school because it is much warmer in winter,and has a hall and a lot of playing fields.There is a Headmaster and four full time teachers in the main school building,and a nursery teacher and a nursery assistant in the Nursery Unit.When children are 11 they leave and go to Treviglas School in Newquay.They have to go by bus.School dinners are cooked in the kitchen.
